meanings.definition: A rounded edge or projection, especially on a stair tread or piece of furniture.
meanings.sent1: The bullnose of the table prevented anyone from getting hurt on its sharp corners.
meanings.sent2: She carefully walked up the stairs, feeling the smooth bullnose under her feet.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten loved to chase its toy under the bullnose of the couch.
meanings.sent4: His smile had a bullnose of kindness that made everyone feel welcome.
meanings.sent5: The bullnose of the cliff jutted out into the sea, creating a picturesque view.

meanings.definition: A type of pliers with a rounded, tapering jaw.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used the bullnose to grip the small bolt securely.
meanings.sent2: He reached for the bullnose in his toolbox to fix the loose wire.
meanings.sent3: The bullnose pliers looked like a friendly alligator ready to snap.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as the grip of the bullnose on the wire.
meanings.sent5: The bullnose of the pliers made it easier to handle delicate objects without damage.

meanings.definition: A type of brick with a rounded edge.
meanings.sent1: The mason carefully placed the bullnose brick to create a smooth finish.
meanings.sent2: The garden wall was built using bullnose bricks for a decorative touch.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the bullnose brick as a hiding spot for its acorns.
meanings.sent4: The bullnose brick stood out among the others, adding elegance to the structure.
meanings.sent5: The sun glinted off the polished surface of the bullnose brick, enhancing its beauty.
